channel.title: Skyrim Online ~Accepting members~
channel.description:
[center][IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/6rpj6a.jpg[/img][/center] Hello i am proudly announcing that as of 1/02/12 we are entering the planning stage of creating a online rpg base upon the game Skyrim V the elder scrolls. this mmorpg game is being created by numerous devlopers but we are currently looking for a team, now not only should you be experienced but you must be patient. [hr] [u][b]What are we looking for:[/b][/u] [ul][li]Senior Systems/Network Administrator[/li] [li]Animator[/li] [li]Environment Artist[/li] [li]Lead-Level Designer[/li] [li]UI/HUD Designer[/li] [li]Animation Systems Programmer[/li] [li]Engine Programmer[/li] [li]Gameplay Programmer[/li] [li]Java/Online Server Programmer[/li] [li]Physics/Gameplay Programmer[/li] [li]User Interface Programmer[/li] [li]Web Developer[/li] [li]General Programmers[/li][/ul] [hr] [b] Do i get paid:[/b] Yes each person on the team will get paid, when the game is released, for example you will get 5% of profit made monthly so if we make 500$ in that month you get 25$ [hr] [b] How are we going to keep contact:[/b] Members on our team are all invited into a msn/skype/dropbox group [hr] [b] Why is this project unlike others:[/b] This project is different from many others, because we strive to achieve we will not give up heck we cant, im currently starting my 2nd semester in video game, and lead design programing and the collage of north Atlantic. [hr] [b]Can you guarentee that the project will not be dropped:[/b] This project cannot be droped due to many reasons, 1. being i funded 250$ for a software engine and 2nd is as part of my collage years i am to give a final review of a gaming project i made, thus will be my final marks, so no it is highly unlikely it will be dropped. [hr] [b]Any proof of development:[/b] No there is no proof yet there will be proof within the next 7 days. [hr] [center][b]About skyrim[/b][/center] Bethesda's flagship fantasy role-playing series returns to Xbox 360 with a new storyline and more detailed, open-world environment. Taking place centuries after the events chronicled in 2006's Oblivion, the game finds the continent of Tamriel in chaos after the High King of Skyrim is found murdered. Yet political turmoil is only the beginning of the problems. Dragons, long believed to be a relic of the past, are now flying across the lands and threaten to tear away the fabric of civilization in one fell swoop. You are Skyrim's last hope, a descendent of the fabled Dragonborn, who can speak the language of dragons and channel their mystical powers after slaying them. The main quest involves discovering why the dragons have returned, but as with previous games in the Elder Scrolls series, you are free to embark on your own adventures. There are five major cities in Skyrim, each home to a different culture and way of life, and an estimated 500 distinct places of interest. The publisher claims the game offers 300 hours of content for those looking to explore every nook and cranny in the 3D world. You can adapt your male or female hero to fit your playing style, whether it's hacking and slashing at creatures directly, slinging arrows from the cover of darkness, or casting powerful spells. There are hundreds of pieces of equipment and weapons to find or purchase, allowing you to mix and match shields, staves, swords, and spells to suit your needs. Defeating enemies earns you experience that can be used to level up attributes in three key areas: magica, health, and stamina. A new graphics engine brings the province of Skyrim to life with surging rivers, rolling clouds, changing weather, and more varied terrain at different elevations. The interface features a more minimalistic scheme than what was used in Oblivion, and the number of voice actors has increased to offer more diversity in the speaking roles. Quests include more dynamic elements, and dragons will appear randomly throughout your travels, giving you the option to flee or to stand your ground and fight. [hr] [u][b]Application Fourm:[/b][/u]
Name: Age: Position Applying for: Years of expirence: why you choose this project: why you want this position: Will you stay loyal: msn: Skype:
[hr] Skyrim is strictly part of Bethesda game studios and i do not own this, how ever Bethesda allow freedom of mind as long as you do not use there engine thus game developmental of skyrim is aloud to certain extends. [hr] [left][IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/18ejrq.png[/img][/left] [right][IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/35i9jsm.png[/img] [/right][center][IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/200vhc5.jpg[/img][/center]

item.title: Skyrim Online ~Accepting members~
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Yea… uh…

  1. GameDev please.
  2. If you give up that easily, don’t bother posting. I’m sick of abandoned developments.
  3. Like people said, if you plan on making money with this you will get sued.

Read full topic

item.title: Skyrim Online ~Accepting members~
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

zyle1992:

Or you can just use the multiplayer mod…

You guys are saying you would get sued for having a skyrim online game, yet they have a multiplayer mod and Bethesda seems to have done nothing to stop it? I don’t think bethesda would mind as long as you were doing it for non-profit. There is a reason they didn’t change the format of their content in the game from oblivion to skyrim. They like people creating mods and putting their own twist on their games.

Read full topic

item.title: Skyrim Online ~Accepting members~
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Do i get paid:

Yes each person on the team will get paid, when the game is released, for example you will get 5% of profit made monthly so if we make 500$ in that month you get 25$

Why is this project unlike others:

This project is different from many others, because we strive to achieve we will not give up heck we cant, im currently starting my 2nd semester in video game, and lead design programing and the collage of north Atlantic.

Can you guarentee that the project will not be dropped:

This project cannot be droped due to many reasons, 1. being i funded 250$ for a software engine and 2nd is as part of my collage years i am to give a final review of a gaming project i made, thus will be my final marks, so no it is highly unlikely it will be dropped.

Good idea, but its not going to work out!
1.Offering to reward someone for the work- not allowed
2.Copyright Issues
3.You would be taking credit from others and saying its yours
|
|
V

as part of my collage years i am to give a final review of a gaming project i made

Read full topic
